page.title: 03Goat Island
page.content: Goat Island is the 15 acres which became separated from the mainland as a result of the Great Landslip of 1839. A pathway through the slip leads from Axmouth to Lyme Regis and the walk takes approximately 4 hours. The chasm now covered with dense woodland has some 120 species of birds, many classified as rare, numerous species of plants, and mammals such as Roe deer and badgers. This area is an interesting geological feature which also provides a mosaic of habitats nationwide and a place for serious research. Visitors are asked to follow the countryside code and special written permission for collecting specimens or leaving the public path is required from the Regional Officer, NCC, Roughmoor, Bishop's Hall, Taunton, TA1 5AA.
